course_title: Special Topics: East Asian Studies: Nat. Identity in Korean Cinema
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 8 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as FILM 385 4)
Topic: National Identity in Korean Cinema
MCP Elective


This course is designed to offer an in-depth introduction to South Korean (hereafter Korean) cinema in the light of its paradoxical role of building and unsettling Korea's national identities since the Korean War armistice in 1953. Throughout the dizzy history of rapid industrialization and modernization, the Korean government has taken advantage of national cinema in a way to create an array of positive national images and identities. While nationalist narratives have pervaded Korean cinema, a number of filmmakers were able to develop internationalist film styles which, rather than remaining ancillary to narrative, has created compelling aesthetics that belies and debunks nationalism.
course_description: Study of East Asian literature, history, society, thought, or culture, alone or in conjunction with other literary or cultural trends. Topics to be announced in advance.
